In a grievance interview, the Manager or HR establishes the nature of the grievance, listens to the employee’s case, clarifies any missing details, explores possible solutions, and ensures mutual understanding of the issue before taking action.
What role does the Manager play in the grievance procedure?

The Manager’s role is to counsel employees on grievance handling, address grievances fairly, ensure a positive working environment, justify any decisions made, and demonstrate fairness and understanding.
What is the role of HR in the grievance procedure?
HR provides counseling on presenting grievances, investigates the circumstances, advises management on resolutions, and acts as an arbitrator in the procedure.
What is the purpose of the Communication Policy?

The purpose of the Communication Policy is to ensure effective communication within the organization without compromising confidentiality and secrecy. It also aims to establish open and consistent communication through defined channels.
Who is the Communication Policy directed to?
The Communication Policy is directed to all employees of the organization.
What are the key objectives of the Communication Policy?

The key objectives of the Communication Policy include ensuring that staff are well informed on matters affecting them and the business, encouraging feedback, communicating the company’s vision and strategic objectives, informing employees about policies and statutory requirements, facilitating employee contributions to the work environment, and responding to employee concerns raised through various communication channels.
What are the core principles of the Communication Policy?

The core principles of the Communication Policy are ensuring effective communication while maintaining confidentiality and secrecy, as well as ensuring open and consistent communication through defined channels.
What are the defined modes of communication within the organization?
The defined modes of communication include the Staff Handbook, newsletters/magazines, circulars, open discussions such as staff meetings, and electronic mail.
What responsibilities does a Line Manager have under the Communication Policy?

A Line Manager is responsible for cascading all relevant information to staff, holding regular staff meetings, submitting staff meeting minutes to the Head of Human Resources, addressing and escalating staff issues, and keeping a record of HR communications on policies and procedures for staff reference.
What responsibilities do the Group Head of Human Resources and HR Business Partners have in communication?

The Group Head of Human Resources and HR Business Partners are responsible for issuing staff handbooks on HR policy, conducting attitude surveys, analyzing and responding to staff concerns, communicating any changes that affect staff, facilitating discussion forums, and visiting business units to hold meetings with staff.
What are the communication responsibilities of all staff?

All staff are responsible for understanding and adhering to policies, raising issues affecting them through appropriate channels, reading all communication materials such as circulars and newsletters, and maintaining confidentiality on sensitive business matters.
How does the organization ensure open communication while maintaining confidentiality?

The organization ensures open communication by defining specific communication channels such as staff meetings, newsletters, and discussion forums. At the same time, it emphasizes maintaining confidentiality on sensitive business matters through clear policies and employee responsibilities.
How are staff meetings utilized in the communication process?

Staff meetings serve as a platform for open discussions, addressing employee concerns, sharing company updates, and fostering teamwork. Line Managers are responsible for holding these meetings regularly and submitting minutes to the Head of Human Resources.
Why is it important for employees to read circulars and newsletters?

Reading circulars and newsletters is essential for employees to stay informed about company policies, business updates, statutory requirements, and any changes affecting their roles. It ensures transparency and alignment with organizational objectives.
How does the policy encourage employee feedback?

The policy encourages employee feedback through structured communication channels such as staff meetings, discussion forums, attitude surveys, individual correspondence, and direct communication with managers and HR representatives.
What role does the HR department play in addressing employee concerns?

The HR department is responsible for analyzing and responding to employee concerns raised through various communication channels, conducting attitude surveys, facilitating discussion forums, and ensuring that any changes affecting employees are promptly communicated.
What should an employee do if they have a workplace concern?
If an employee has a workplace concern, they should raise the issue with their immediate manager, HR Business Partner, or any manager of their choice through the appropriate communication channels.
What is the purpose of the Speak Up Policy at LMI Holdings?

The purpose of the Speak Up Policy at LMI Holdings is to explain how employees can raise concerns about suspected misconduct in confidence and without fear of retaliation. It also describes what employees can expect from LMI Holdings if they choose to speak up.
Who does the Speak Up Policy apply to?

The Speak Up Policy applies to all employees within LMI Holdings. It is designed to cover situations where an employee raises a concern about suspected or known misconduct or wrongdoing in good faith.
What types of concerns should be reported under this policy?

Employees are encouraged to report concerns related to suspected misconduct, illegal activities, fraud, abuse related to accounting or auditing matters, possible violations of laws or government regulations, violations of the LMI Holdings Code of Business Conduct, or breaches of internal policies.
How does LMI Holdings ensure non-retaliation for employees who report concerns?

LMI Holdings strictly prohibits retaliation against employees who raise integrity concerns in good faith or cooperate in an investigation. If an employee experiences or suspects retaliation, they are encouraged to report it.
What are the responsibilities of employees under the Speak Up Policy?

Employees should be familiar with applicable policies, promptly raise any integrity concerns through the provided channels, retain relevant documents for investigations, cooperate fully in company investigations, and report concerns in good faith without making false allegations.
What are the responsibilities of managers under the Speak Up Policy?

Managers must create an environment that promotes ethical behavior, encourage employees to raise concerns freely, prohibit retaliation, treat reported concerns with discretion, respect employees who report concerns, and promptly act on and escalate integrity concerns as necessary.
What are the available channels for reporting concerns under the Speak Up Policy?

Employees can report concerns to their line manager, another member of line management, People and Culture, the Legal Department, the Compliance Department, the Code Ambassador, the Ethics and Compliance Committee, or through the confidential 'Speak-Up' helpline available online or via telephone.
Can employees report concerns anonymously?

Yes, employees can report concerns anonymously using the 'Speak-Up' helpline, where permitted by local law. However, the effectiveness of an investigation may be limited if an individual chooses to remain anonymous.
What should an employee do if they have been personally involved in non-compliance?

Employees who have been personally involved in an instance of non-compliance are still expected to self-report. It is preferable to voluntarily disclose the issue rather than have it raised by another party.
How does LMI Holdings handle confidentiality when a concern is reported?

LMI Holdings treats reported concerns confidentially to the fullest extent possible, limiting information sharing as required by legal obligations. Internal anonymity is provided where possible, but it may not be guaranteed if external legal action occurs.
What happens after an employee reports a concern?

After a concern is reported, there will be no adverse consequences for good-faith reports. Employees will be informed of the outcome of the investigation, subject to confidentiality and legal constraints. Malicious or bad-faith reports may lead to disciplinary action.
Who should an employee contact for further clarification on the Speak Up Policy?
Employees can speak to their line manager, a Code Ambassador, or contact the Compliance Department via email at compliance@lmighana.com for further clarification on the Speak Up Policy.
What is the purpose of the confidentiality policy at LMI group?
The purpose of the confidentiality policy at LMI group is to outline employees' responsibilities in handling company information in a sensitive and confidential manner.
Who is the confidentiality policy directed to?
The confidentiality policy is directed to all employees of LMI group.
What responsibilities do employees have regarding confidential information?

Employees must protect company and client information, avoid unauthorized disclosure, and comply with confidentiality requirements outlined in their contracts. They should also securely store and dispose of confidential data.
What types of information are considered confidential under the policy?

Confidential information includes sensitive employee data, client information, pricing, research plans and reports, systems, policies, designs, product data, source codes, prototypes, formulas, and acquisition data.
Can employees disclose confidential information to third parties?
No, employees may not disclose confidential information to third parties without explicit written consent from their supervisor.
Are ex-employees still bound by the confidentiality policy?
Yes, both current and former employees are prohibited from disclosing confidential information even after leaving the company.
What must employees do with confidential information upon leaving the company?
Employees must return or delete all confidential information in their possession, including documents, electronic files, and other records, as requested by the company.
How should employees protect confidential documents?
Employees should use passwords to secure electronic documents, keep physical documents locked away, and dispose of surplus documents in confidential waste bins.
What are the consequences of breaching confidentiality?
A breach of confidentiality may result in disciplinary action, including dismissal. In some cases, legal prosecution may also apply.
Who has access to employees’ personal and sensitive information?
Only authorized employees with a valid reason may access personal and sensitive employee information. They must observe strict confidentiality when handling such records.
What is the purpose of LMI Holdings' Health & Safety Policy?
The purpose of LMI Holdings' Health & Safety Policy is to instill a culture of personal ownership and motivation to achieve Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) operating excellence.
Who is the Health & Safety Policy directed to?
The Health & Safety Policy is directed to all employees of LMI Holdings.
What are some key principles outlined in LMI Holdings' Health & Safety Policy?

Some key principles include: demonstrating visible safety leadership, prioritizing safety over operational demands, standardizing operational procedures, monitoring key performance indicators, and fostering a culture of personal ownership in safety.
What authority do employees have under the 'Stop Work Authority' principle?
Under the 'Stop Work Authority' principle, all employees have the authorization to stop work if they believe it is unsafe to proceed.
How does LMI Holdings ensure fire safety within its premises?
LMI Holdings ensures fire safety by regularly maintaining and testing fire-fighting equipment, training fire marshals, and displaying fire instructions and related notices prominently.
What responsibilities does the Human Resources (HR) department have regarding the Health & Safety Policy?

The HR department is responsible for coordinating the health program, making recommendations, conducting health and safety training, investigating incidents, and ensuring the policy is implemented effectively.
What steps must line managers take to ensure workplace safety?

Line managers must ensure first-aid kits are stocked, fire equipment is inspected, staff are trained in emergency response, sanitary facilities are maintained, and workplace hazards are minimized through regular inspections and safety protocols.
What responsibilities do employees have under the Health & Safety Policy?

Employees must take reasonable steps to ensure their own safety and that of others, report hazards and accidents, follow safety instructions, cooperate in investigations, and participate in fire evacuation procedures.
What measures are in place to maintain hygiene in the workplace?
Measures include ensuring lavatories and kitchens are clean, conducting medical check-ups for food handlers, regularly removing waste, and implementing cleaning routines across operational areas.
What are the responsibilities of Property Management under the Health & Safety Policy?
Property Management is responsible for maintaining emergency tool kits, first-aid boxes, and fire extinguishers in vehicles, as well as distributing and enforcing driving rules among company drivers.
What is the purpose of the Environment Protection Policy?
The purpose of the Environment Protection Policy is to minimize any adverse impact of the company’s operations on the environment.
Who is the Environment Protection Policy directed to?
The Environment Protection Policy is directed to all employees of the company.
Summarize the policy statement of the Environment Protection Policy.

The company believes in balancing commercial and environmental protection, ensuring responsible resource use and waste disposal while encouraging clients to minimize environmental damage in their operations.
List the key principles of the Environment Protection Policy.

The key principles include: 1) Managing operations using best practices for resource use and waste disposal, 2) Encouraging clients to prevent unnecessary environmental damage, and 3) Integrating environmental considerations into business decisions.
What actions does management take to conserve natural resources?
Management conserves natural resources by making unused furniture and equipment available to the community and minimizing overseas travel through video/teleconferencing.
What responsibilities do employees have under the Environment Protection Policy?

Employees are responsible for conserving energy by turning off unused electrical appliances, using natural ventilation where possible, and promoting recycling and reuse of materials like scrap paper and printer waste.
How does the company integrate environmental considerations into business decisions?
The company ensures that environmental impact is assessed when making business decisions and encourages clients to adopt environmentally friendly practices in their projects and processes.
What is the purpose of the Personal Accident Insurance policy?
The purpose of the Personal Accident Insurance policy is to ensure that all employees are covered against injury or death resulting from accidents within the organization's premises.
Who does the Personal Accident Insurance policy apply to?
The policy applies to all employees of the organization and provides 24-hour coverage.
What are the key principles of the Personal Accident Insurance policy?
The policy follows the Workmen’s Compensation Act, requiring every employer to provide coverage for any injury sustained by employees within the employer’s premises.
What conditions must be met for an employee to receive compensation for permanent disability?
An employee must sustain an injury that is assessed and declared by a doctor as a permanent disability. The extent of disability is expressed in percentage form.
Is death due to illness covered under the Personal Accident Insurance policy?
No, compensation for death is only provided if the death results from an accident. Death due to normal illness is not covered.
What are some exceptions to the Personal Accident Insurance coverage?

The policy does not cover claims arising from pre-existing physical defects, pregnancy, intentional self-harm, insanity, injuries sustained before the lower age limit or after the upper age limit, and damages caused by war or rebellion.
What steps must an employee take to file a claim under the Personal Accident Insurance policy?
The employee must provide written notice to the insurer within 14 days of the incident, submit medical evidence if required, and comply with any medical examinations requested by the insurer.
Can the insurer cancel the Personal Accident Insurance policy?
Yes, the insurer can cancel the policy by sending a seven-day notice to the insured’s last known address. The insured will receive a refund for the unexpired period of insurance.
What happens if a claim is disputed?
If a claim is disputed, it must be referred to arbitration. If not referred within twelve months of denial, the claim is considered abandoned and is no longer recoverable.
Does the Personal Accident Insurance policy cover interest on compensation payments?
No, any compensation payable under this policy does not accrue interest.
What is the purpose of the company's travel policy?

The purpose of the company's travel policy is to ensure that the company receives the best possible value for money on travel expenditures while prioritizing the business traveler's comfort, well-being, and effectiveness at their destination.
Who is directed to follow the company's travel policy?
The travel policy applies to all persons working for or on behalf of the company, including consultants, whose travel costs are ultimately paid by the organization.
How can the company minimize expenditure on air travel?

The company can minimize air travel expenses by maximizing the use of video or telephone conferences, reducing the number of trips, planning travel around preferred airline schedules, being flexible on routing, informing travel agents of future travel plans, minimizing the number of employees per trip, and utilizing cheaper ticket options when viable.
What authorization is required for air travel?

All air travel must be formally authorized using a Travel Authorization Form (TAF). Business class travel must be authorized by the CEO or a designated representative, while economy class travel must be approved by an individual’s immediate superior and the CEO or CEO’s representative.
Who is responsible for booking air travel?

All air travel must be booked through appointed preferred travel agents who are fully aware of the travel policy. In exceptional cases, the company can book its own flights with approval from the CEO or the CEO’s representative.
What are the rules regarding the class of travel for employees?

Economy class must be used for all trips with a flying time of 6 hours or less, except for Executive Directors who may use business class. Business class may be used for flights exceeding 6 hours at the authorizer’s discretion. Economy class is mandatory for all training-related travel, regardless of flight duration or scheduled meetings.
What are the company's policies on preferred airlines?

Where preferred airlines are designated globally or locally, they must be used to realize negotiated benefits. Travel authorizers should not approve trips on non-preferred airlines unless absolutely unavoidable, and any such policy breach must be authorized by the CEO before ticket issuance.
Are there limitations on the number of employees traveling together?

Yes. Only one of the Chairman, CEO, or Finance Director may travel on a flight. A maximum of three Board Directors (including no more than two executive directors) may travel together unless explicitly approved by the Chairman or CEO. A maximum of three management members from any business unit may travel together, with the CEO's approval required for exceeding this limit. No more than eight staff members may travel on the same flight without CEO approval.
What are the accommodation policies for employees on business trips?

Employees must use preferred hotels as per the company’s regularly circulated list. If no preferred accommodation is available, non-preferred hotels may be used while minimizing costs. Where room types are specified, only those may be booked.
What are the policies for short-term assignments outside the home country?

For assignments up to 6 months, salaries and allowances continue from the home base. Bonuses are determined based on home base performance. Employees receive free furnished bachelor accommodation with utilities covered. A daily subsistence allowance is provided, and local transport between accommodation and work is arranged or reimbursed. Medical expenses incurred during the assignment are covered by the company. Travel expenses, including return trips and additional trips based on marital status, are also covered.
How does the company handle local travel expenses?

The company reimburses necessary and ordinary business-related local travel expenses, following clear guidelines to ensure compliance with company regulations. Expenses must align with company policy and demonstrate proper stewardship of funds.
What types of expenses are considered non-reimbursable?

Non-reimbursable expenses include fines and penalties, vehicle cleaning costs, non-business-related entertainment, and memberships or purchases for personal use unless pre-approved by a management representative.
What is the purpose of the LMI Holdings vehicle policy?

The purpose of the LMI Holdings vehicle policy is to provide direction on the eligibility, use, and management of company cars while focusing on safety and the reduction of road traffic accidents (RTAs).
Who is the vehicle policy directed to?
The policy is directed to General Managers, HR Managers, Departmental Heads, and Team Leaders within LMI Holdings.
What are the two categories of company vehicles provided to team members?
The two categories of company vehicles provided to team members are 'Functional Cars' and 'Courtesy Cars.'
Who determines which team members qualify for 'Functional' cars?

The Executive Committee (EXCO) determines which team members qualify for 'Functional' cars based on their job roles, including Senior Frontline Sales, Business Development, Commercial, Operations, Engineering, and Credit Controllers.
What level of managers are entitled to 'Courtesy' cars?
Managers at LMI Grading Levels 14 to 15 are entitled to 'Courtesy' cars, as determined by the EXCO.
How is fuel allocation determined for team members who qualify for company vehicles?
Fuel allocation for team members who qualify for 'Functional' or 'Courtesy' cars is determined by the HR Business Partner (HR BP) and is subject to the subsidiary's ability to pay.
What happens to team members who do not qualify for company vehicles?

Team members who do not qualify for 'Functional' or 'Courtesy' cars will either be allocated fuel based on their job roles, provided access to company staff transportation, or reimbursed for transportation costs when conducting official business outside office premises.
Who is responsible for ensuring compliance with the car policy?
The Managing Director (MD) or General Manager (GM) is responsible for ensuring compliance with the car policy and implementing it correctly.
What is the process for requesting a car replacement?
A car replacement request must be submitted by the Subsidiary MD/GM based on the criteria outlined in the Asset Disposal Policy.
Are employees allowed to use company vehicles for personal business?
No, LMI Holdings vehicles are strictly for business use and are not to be used for activities related to other companies or personal business.
Who is eligible to drive an LMI Holdings company vehicle?
Only authorized LMI Holdings employees with a valid driver’s license for the class of vehicle being operated, at least one year of driving experience, and meeting all licensing requirements.
What are some violations that can lead to losing company vehicle privileges?

Violations include having a suspended or revoked driver's license, being involved in three or more chargeable accidents within 36 months, driving under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances, and failing to comply with road safety regulations.
What maintenance responsibilities do authorized drivers have?
Authorized drivers must maintain company vehicles properly, including regular oil changes, tire maintenance, brake checks, and ensuring road-worthiness to guarantee safe operation.
What costs does the company cover for vehicle maintenance?
The company covers standard maintenance costs such as tire replacements, battery changes, oil changes, brake adjustments, motor tune-ups, and legal registration fees.
Can an employee’s spouse or relatives use a company vehicle?
No, the use of a company vehicle by an employee’s spouse or relatives is strictly prohibited.
What happens to a company vehicle when an employee is no longer eligible for it?
The vehicle may be reallocated to another eligible employee, returned to the company, or made available for purchase under the LMI Holdings Asset Disposal Policy.
What is the purpose of LMI Holdings' Diversity and Inclusion Policy?

The purpose of LMI Holdings' Diversity and Inclusion Policy is to foster a culture that accepts and respects individual differences while recognizing and valuing diverse backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives. This approach enhances employee potential, drives innovation, and improves company performance.
Who is the Diversity and Inclusion Policy directed to?

The Diversity and Inclusion Policy at LMI Holdings applies to all employees, including those on full-time, part-time, fixed-term, or indefinite contracts, as well as interns, trainees, and third-party pay-rolled workers.
Summarize the key principles of LMI Holdings' Diversity and Inclusion Policy.

LMI Holdings is committed to identifying and addressing diversity challenges, ensuring compliance with legal and ethical standards, eliminating discriminatory behaviors, providing a harassment-free workplace, adopting internal processes to support inclusion, and promoting awareness of diversity benefits.
What does LMI Holdings define as diversity and inclusion?

LMI Holdings defines diversity as a workforce reflective of different cultures, generations, genders, ethnic groups, nationalities, abilities, and social backgrounds. Inclusion is about creating a workplace where every employee has the opportunity to contribute to business success and is valued for their unique skills and experiences.
What responsibilities do employees and managers have under this policy?
Employees must ensure their behavior aligns with the Diversity and Inclusion Policy. Managers are responsible for supporting policy implementation and ensuring their teams adhere to its principles.
Who is responsible for overseeing the implementation of the Diversity and Inclusion Policy?

The corporate diversity and inclusion team establishes global processes and metrics, while Human Resources provides training, implements local procedures, and supports managers in addressing non-compliance.
How does LMI Holdings ensure a workplace free from discrimination and harassment?

LMI Holdings commits to removing unlawful discriminatory behavior at all hierarchical levels, upholding a Code of Business Conduct, and ensuring all employees and service providers have the right to a harassment-free workplace.
What is the purpose of the LMI Disability Policy?
The purpose of the LMI Disability Policy is to support and accelerate the fulfilment of the company’s strategic goals by providing guidance on the management of disability issues in the workplace.
Who is the LMI Disability Policy directed to?
The LMI Disability Policy is directed to all employees of LMI Holdings.
What are the key goals of the LMI Disability Policy?

The key goals of the LMI Disability Policy are to ensure equal opportunities in the workplace for people with disabilities, improve employment prospects, and promote a safe, accessible, and healthy workplace.
How does LMI Holdings ensure equal opportunities for persons with disabilities?

LMI Holdings ensures equal opportunities for persons with disabilities by ensuring that recruitment processes, terms of employment, and opportunities for promotion, transfer, and training do not discriminate based on disability. They also provide reasonable accommodations such as specialist equipment and reorganize the working environment.
What are the guiding principles of LMI Holdings regarding disability in the workplace?

LMI Holdings is committed to providing equal access to employment, advancement, and retention, recognizing the importance of a diverse workforce. They aim to treat people with disabilities with dignity and respect while ensuring that any specific requirements related to disability are met.
How does LMI Holdings approach the recruitment of candidates with disabilities?

LMI Holdings strives to be an employer of choice for the best candidates, regardless of disability. They hire the best person for the job, tapping into sources of top-notch talent, and positive measures for people with disabilities are not considered discrimination.
What is the responsibility of managers in implementing the LMI Disability Policy?
Managers are responsible for supporting the implementation of the LMI Disability Policy by ensuring that the behaviour and actions within their teams align with the policy's principles.
What role does the global HR Leadership team play in the LMI Disability Policy?
The global HR Leadership team is responsible for establishing the global processes, metrics, and systems that support the LMI Disability Policy.
What is expected of employees in terms of the LMI Disability Policy?
Employees are responsible for ensuring that their behaviour and actions align with the LMI Disability Policy.
How does LMI Holdings ensure the effective implementation of the Disability Policy?
LMI Holdings ensures effective implementation by providing local training, supporting managers, and establishing processes and systems that align with the policy principles.
How does LMI Holdings address the specific needs of employees with disabilities?

LMI Holdings ensures that employees with disabilities are not put at a disadvantage. They provide necessary support such as specialist equipment and adjustments to the working environment to meet the employee’s specific requirements.
What does LMI Holdings' commitment to disability equality mean?

LMI Holdings is committed to disability equality by fostering an inclusive workplace culture, providing equal terms and conditions of employment, and making adjustments where necessary to include people with disabilities in the workforce.
What actions are required from employees to support the LMI Disability Policy?

Employees are expected to contribute to creating and sustaining a workplace culture that adheres to the principles of the LMI Disability Policy, ensuring that their behaviour supports its implementation.
How does LMI Holdings view positive measures for people with disabilities?
LMI Holdings views positive measures aimed at ensuring equality of opportunity for people with disabilities as beneficial and not as discrimination against other staff members.
What is the purpose of the IT Systems, Emails, and Internet Policy at LMI Holdings?

The purpose of the IT Systems, Emails, and Internet Policy at LMI Holdings is to outline the company's guidelines for the acceptable use of the internet and emails, ensuring that misuse of computers by employees does not lead to negative repercussions on IT systems or legal liability.
What should employees of LMI Holdings do to avoid the misuse of email for personal business?
Employees should refrain from using email for private commercial business or soliciting business for individuals inside or outside of LMI Holdings. This is prohibited under the company's policy.
Can employees use the internet at LMI Holdings for personal activities?
Yes, limited personal use of the internet is acceptable at LMI Holdings, as long as it does not conflict with the company’s business and is conducted during personal time.
What is prohibited when using email at LMI Holdings?

Prohibited email activities at LMI Holdings include sending or forwarding chain letters, classified ads, sexually harassing or offensive content, defamatory material, unlawful material (e.g., pornography), or copyrighted content without proper authorization.
What should employees do if they lose their laptop?

If an employee loses their laptop, they must report the loss to the IT desk immediately to prevent unauthorized access to the system. Failing to report the loss is a violation of the company's computer policy.
What actions are considered a violation of the company's computer security policy?

Violations of the computer security policy include disclosing passwords to others, providing system access to unauthorized users, attempting to gain access to unauthorized system resources, and failing to lock or log off a computer when unattended.
What are employees required to do if they need to transfer files between computers?
Employees should use email (encrypted when necessary), shared drives, or an Iron key to transfer files between computers, ensuring that sensitive data is securely transferred.
Is downloading games allowed on the company's network?
No, downloading games on the company’s network is expressly forbidden under the company’s IT policy.
What is the company’s policy regarding password security?
LMI Holdings’ policy requires that passwords be kept confidential by the individual employee. Disclosing passwords to others or providing unauthorized users access to systems is prohibited.
What should employees do with a company laptop when they are not using it?
Employees should lock their laptops when left unattended and ensure they are logged off and shut down at the end of the day to prevent unauthorized use.
What does LMI Holdings do to safeguard information on lost laptops?

LMI Holdings ensures the protection of information on lost laptops by requiring employees to report the loss immediately and by using hard drive encryption. If the laptop is encrypted, company-related files and folders remain protected.
Are employees allowed to load personal software onto their computers?
No, employees are not allowed to load personal software onto their company computers without approval from IT staff, as personal software may cause conflicts with the company’s systems.
How should employees handle proprietary company information in emails?

Employees should ensure that proprietary company information is only transmitted via email when authorized by management, and, when possible, the email should be encrypted to protect the confidentiality of the information.
What are the consequences for failing to follow the IT Systems, Emails, and Internet Policy?

Failure to follow the IT Systems, Emails, and Internet Policy can result in disciplinary actions, including dismissal. Certain violations may be deemed gross misconduct, justifying immediate dismissal.
What should an employee do if they need assistance with downloading software or avoiding potential viruses?

If an employee is unsure about downloading software or avoiding viruses, they should contact the IT staff for assistance to ensure they do not download potentially dangerous programs from untrusted sources.
What is the purpose of LMI Holdings' policy on recreational and social events?

The purpose of this policy is to ensure that while attending social events and using recreational facilities is enjoyable for all employees, minimum standards of good behaviour must be adhered to. The organization must also comply with its legal obligations and responsibilities.
Who is the recreational and social events policy directed to?
The policy is directed to General Managers, HR Managers, Departmental Heads, and Team Leaders.
What behavior is expected from employees at work-related social functions where alcohol is served?

While alcohol may be consumed at such events, employees are expected to behave responsibly. The organization does not endorse excessive drinking or improper conduct, and employees will be held accountable for their actions.
What will happen if an employee behaves aggressively or improperly during a work-related event?

Employees who engage in aggressive behavior, fight, indulge in lewd conduct, or bring the organization into disrepute will be subject to the organization’s disciplinary procedures, which could include dismissal.
What is the company's stance on employees driving under the influence after a work-related event?

Employees who are above the legal limit for drinking and driving must not drive vehicles owned by the organization. If they are found to be driving under the influence or giving lifts to colleagues while impaired, they will face disciplinary action, including dismissal.
Can employees organize informal events after work at venues close to the workplace?

Employees can organize informal events, but they must conduct themselves properly to avoid bringing the organization into disregard. Such events may be considered work-related functions by the courts, and employees should be mindful of their behavior.
What must employees do if they want to organize a celebration or event on the organization's premises?
Employees must seek prior permission from the HR Manager before organizing any celebration or event on the organization's premises.
What is the company's policy on employees excluding others from social events?

Employees are expected to be inclusive when extending invitations to social events. Excluding colleagues based on age, sex, race, disability, religion, or sexual orientation may be considered discrimination, and complaints about such exclusion will be investigated, potentially resulting in disciplinary action.
What should employees do if they wish to organize an event at the company's premises?
Employees must obtain prior approval from the HR Business Partner and the facility manager before organizing any event at the company's premises.
What is the organization's policy on employees' behavior after attending a work-related event where alcohol was served?

Employees are expected to arrive at work the following day in a fit state to perform their duties. If they are absent or unfit for work, it may result in an investigation and potential disciplinary action.
What is the purpose of the internship and national service policy?
The purpose of this policy is to ensure that internship programs are properly managed and to provide students and graduates with the opportunity to gain industry experience.
Who is the internship and national service policy directed to?
The policy is directed to General Managers, HR Managers, Departmental Heads, and Team Leaders.
How is the internship program structured according to the policy?

The internship program is designed to provide a pool of young, talented, and potential employees. Interns are assigned to areas related to their course of study or areas of interest, with quarterly appraisals to inform decisions about potential recruitment.
What are the main guidelines for internship opportunities at LMI Holdings?

Internship opportunities are based on the company's requirements, with multiple recruitment routes. Interns are assigned to relevant areas to unearth their potential, and the number of interns in any department is capped based on the agreed limit with senior management.
How long do internships typically last, and can they be extended?
Internships are initially for 3 months, with the option for an 11-month National Service term, renewable for a second 3-month term based on satisfactory performance.
What is the allowance policy for interns?
Interns are paid a monthly allowance, with the specific amount determined by the HR Manager upon approval from the Managing Director or General Manager.
What steps are involved in recruiting interns for LMI Holdings?

The HR Manager determines the internship requirements for each department in consultation with the Department Manager. The HR Manager then contacts institutions and arranges recruitment, followed by interviews in collaboration with senior management.
What does the letter given to selected interns include?
The letter provided to selected interns outlines the conditions of the internship, including the duration, performance assessments, job responsibilities, and allowances.
How is intern performance assessed, and can their internship be extended?

Intern performance is assessed by line supervisors at the end of their assignment. If performance is satisfactory, the department manager may recommend an extension of the internship for another 3 months, depending on departmental needs.
What happens if the number of interns in a department exceeds the agreed limit?

If the number of interns in a department exceeds the agreed limit, it may lead to a breach of the policy, as the number of interns must not exceed the optimum number set with the Managing Director or General Manager.
What is the purpose of the company's separation policy?
The purpose of the company's separation policy is to ensure that all separations are well managed, with minimal interruptions to the company’s operations.
What is the process for managing resignation within the company?

When an employee resigns, they must give one month's notice or pay one month's salary in lieu of notice. Managers who use a company car must hand it over on the last working day, and any accrued leave will be fully paid.
How does the company handle redundancy situations?

In cases of redundancy, the organization sets criteria and determines how many staff will be affected. A redundancy package is drawn up in consultation with staff representatives, and employees are informed of the details. The package includes severance pay and other benefits.
What does the company offer in terms of benefits for employees retiring on medical grounds?

Employees retiring on medical grounds are paid benefits from SSNIT, along with 20% of their basic pay for each completed year of service. The decision is made based on the employee's health status as determined by the company doctor.
What actions can lead to summary dismissal at the company?

Summary dismissal can occur for serious misconduct, such as disobeying work instructions, assaulting staff or customers, negligence of duty, or committing criminal acts during employment. Employees summarily dismissed for serious misconduct forfeit any terminal benefits.
What is the company's policy on normal retirement?
The company's normal retirement age is 60 years, in accordance with statutory law, after which employees qualify for pension benefits.
What happens if an employee dies while still in service?
If an employee dies while in service, their next of kin or estate administrators will receive three times the employee's last annual salary, along with other applicable pension benefits.
What happens if an employee is absent from work without approval?
An employee who is absent for more than five consecutive days without company approval is considered to have vacated their post and will be summarily dismissed.
What is the procedure for conducting an exit interview?
Line managers and HR must conduct an exit interview for all voluntarily departing staff. The completed exit interview form is sent to HR for analysis and the preparation of a management report.
What is the Leavers Checklist, and why is it important?

The Leavers Checklist ensures that all necessary steps are completed for employees leaving the company. It is signed by the line manager and HR, then forwarded to the HR manager to ensure proper follow-through and is filed for record-keeping.
